p: This study verified that, compared to the usual clinical practice, the addition of weekly SMS sending was economically more effective in reducing the circulating viral load of patients infected with HIV and on ART. Within the period studied, the weekly SMS intervention increased by 26% the chance of the patient having an undetectable viral load. Despite the additional cost of the SMS intervention for each research subject, a long-term saving was verified, as shown in the economic impact study, due to the reduction in the incidence of HIV infections.
